originalText.text: If I could leave 0 stars I would, this wine stores atmosphere is dead and unwelcoming. I and my colleague were looking around for a certain wine for 10 minutes and she even asked if they had the wine we were looking for, and the workers did not respond at all. I would recommend you shop at other wine stores. 0/5

I and my colleague were looking around for a certain wine for 10 minutes and she even asked if they had the wine we were looking for, and the workers did not respond at all. I would recommend you shop at other wine stores. 0/5

originalText.text: I'm a regular customer on this store and I didn't have any problem before. But today I bought a new bottle of wine and the person in the front desk named "Jose" is very nasty person and disrespectful. I asked him why don't display the charge for the paper bag in order to tell their customers. Jose told me "You have to go to online and we not refund the money, period. I'm the manager of this store." As a result, I don't want to buy anything in this store anymore. The owner of this store is going to lose a lot of customers.

originalText.text: I have been here a few times now and, sadly, I have yet to find a bottle of wine that I like. The service was fine. I asked for a recommendation and I was shown to several different bottles from various regions. Unfortunately, the wine didn't quite meet the criteria I specified. One of the things I mentioned was well-balanced / less acidic, and the wine I ended up getting was quite acid rich. The store is well lit and well designed, but the wine they sell is just not my taste. It's unfortunate because it's the closest liquor store from my building.

text.text: I have been here a few times now and, sadly, I have yet to find a bottle of wine that I like. The service was fine. originalText.text:
Don't shop here! Such an awful frustrating experience that I felt I needed to take the time write a review. I have to preface it that we have been loyal customers here since the store opened and it has been our go to wine store but we where shocked at the lack of customer service/unprofessionalism.

I purchased a can of white wine which I have done many times in the past  over the years (the same one). Upon opening at home I could immediately tell it was bad. Gold color, strong smell, sour and metallic taste. I only took 1 sip but it was obviously undrinkable.

Not a huge deal although it was inconvenient to have to go back out to the store. Of course we thought they would just replace it as any place would do if they sell you something thats spoiled or expired.

We politely went to let them know so they could be aware of the product they are selling and asked to swap if for something of the same price but they flat out refused. The guy who claimed to be the manager was rude and verbally combative. They tried to tell us we are just unfamiliar with this wine because we haven't bought it before (which we have) and essentially said "too bad, we are not going to do anything about it".

They shouldn't be selling bad wine, but what was more upsetting is that we are regular customers there and they couldn't extend the courtesy to replace the product out of basic decency. Instead giving a huge attitude and negating everything we were saying. They don't care about the quality of their products or about their customers.

We left with nothing and tossed the gross wine. They lost our business.

originalText.text:
Please don’t listen to these angry reviews or things like not having selection.

Pros:
- solid selection from low to high end
- clean and organized
- friendly staff (and dog treats)
- lots of refrigerated wines (more than what you see / look behind the front row)
- open late - most decent wine shops close early
- they will deliver

Cons:
- the staff often hasn’t tasted the vast majority of wines so cannot give great feedback.  If you’re picky you should use an app anyway (Vivino)
- they’re overpriced between 20-35% but I’ve found that in Manhattan.  If you want higher end wines priced well, go to SommCellar around the corner.  But that’ll start in the $40 range
- they don’t have paper bags with handles
